meanings.definition: The process of removing minerals from something, such as water or bone.
meanings.sent1: The demineralization of the water made it less healthy to drink.
meanings.sent2: The dentist explained that demineralization of the tooth enamel can lead to cavities.
meanings.sent3: The demineralization of the soil left the plants feeling a bit undernourished.
meanings.sent4: The demineralization of the rock formation revealed its true colors.
meanings.sent5: The demineralization of the metal made it weaker and more prone to rust.

meanings.definition: The act of depleting minerals from a substance.
meanings.sent1: The demineralization of the food product was done to increase its shelf life.
meanings.sent2: The demineralization of the soil due to over-farming caused nutrient deficiencies.
meanings.sent3: The demineralization of the mineral water seemed counterintuitive.
meanings.sent4: The demineralization of the ocean floor exposed hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: The demineralization of the bone structure weakened its integrity over time.
